Notes (symptom mods / cues): Arm hangs heavy; movement from gentle body sway; small range.
Slide to first stretch, not pain; smooth tempo.
Shoulder relaxed; slow, comfortable range.
Think small; shoulders down; no shrugging.
In through nose; longer exhale; let floor support you.
Use chair height that feels safe; slow control both ways; push through feet not arms if possible; stop if dizzy; on fatigue days reduce reps not depth.
Lift only as high as comfortable; keep spine tall; slow rhythm; if abdominal strain or nausea, make movement smaller or alternate legs slower.
Press through balls of feet; slow up and down; helps circulation; if cramping, reduce height; avoid bouncing.
Lift only to pain-free height; shoulders relaxed; avoid shrugging; small range OK post-op; lower slowly.
Lift shoulders gently toward ears, slow release; do not force; good for tension relief; keep breathing smooth.
Small rotation; move from upper back not low back; stay pain-free; exhale as you turn; avoid holding breath.
Body straight, slow tempo; step closer for easier; elbows soft; stop if shoulder pain; reduce depth on fatigue days.
Feet hip-width; squeeze gently, not maximal; lift only to comfortable height; avoid breath holding; if back discomfort, make lift smaller.
Use low step; slow control; hold support if needed; lead with stronger leg on hard days; stop if knee pain.
Light band; squeeze shoulder blades gently; keep shoulders down; small range post-op; stop before fatigue affects form.
Control down, light touch to chair; push through heels; stop if knee pain; reduce depth on fatigue days.
Lift knees only to comfortable height; tall posture; slow rhythm; good for balance; hold support if needed.
Light weights; shoulders relaxed; walk tall; short distances; stop if grip fatigue or arm heaviness.
Small step back; hold support; shallow depth; knee stays over toes; stop if balance feels unsafe.
Light band; press slowly; shoulders down; stop before fatigue alters form; reduce range if post-op tightness.
Light resistance; press only pain-free range; avoid shrugging; stop early if arm heaviness.
Light band; squeeze shoulder blades gently; small range OK; slow control; helps posture.
Hold support; slow up/down; improves walking strength; reduce height on fatigue days.
Push hips back; neutral spine; small range first; no back strain; slow tempo.
Opposite arm/leg reach; small range; slow control; keep hips level; stop if balance feels unstable.
Feet elevated if comfortable; gently point and flex ankles; slow rhythm; good for swelling, long sitting, travel, chemo fatigue days.
Heel down, gentle lean; stretch not strain; steady breathing.
Tiny slow circles or half rolls; no forcing; stay pain-free.
One hand chest, one belly; slow inhale nose, longer exhale; relax shoulders.
Hold support; move leg out small range; upright posture; slow control.
Split stance; small range first; hold support for balance; knee tracks over toes; push through front heel; stop if knee pain or wobble increases.
Shoulders supported on sofa; band across hips; push through heels; ribs down; controlled tempo; small range on fatigue days; stop if back strain.
Band under feet and over shoulders or hands; sit back and down; knees track comfortably; chest tall; controlled tempo; reduce depth on fatigue days; hold support if balance unsure.
Upper back supported on sofa/chair; band across hips + under feet. Drive through heels; ribs down; small range if sore. Stop if back strain. On fatigue days: fewer reps, slower tempo.
Band anchored behind at chest height. Hands close; elbows stay nearer ribs. Press forward smoothly; don’t lock elbows. Reduce range if chest/shoulder tight; stop early if arm heaviness.
Band under feet. Soft elbows; lift to below shoulder height; shoulders down; neck long. Keep range small. Stop if pinching, heaviness, swelling, or pain.
Band under feet; raise hands forward to comfortable height (often below shoulder). Ribs down; avoid shrugging. Small range on fatigue days; stop if shoulder pinch/heaviness.
Stand tall on band; thumbs-up grip; elbows stay by sides; curl smoothly. No swinging. Reduce band tension if arm feels heavy or sore.
Stand on band; palms-up; elbows close to ribs; slow up/slow down. Keep wrists neutral. Reduce tension/volume on fatigue days.
